it's 50 years old it sounds like crap
write a new song I know those are harsh

like I know them like the back of my

bad bad not good has the same attitude
about jazz and it's not like jazz has

good but the
has a lot of jazz these days is now kind

it's not that new of a sound or concept
because hip-hop in a lot of ways has
always reflected a jazz influence the
Tribe Called Quest J Dilla diggable
planets DJ premier Madlib the roots Kid
Koala the Beastie Boys to the list of
hip-hop artists that have sampled or

goes on forever but we've got to admit
that if we were going to make a list of
jazz musicians who have celebrated hip
hop the list is going to be much shorter
the link between hip hop and jazz

well first off these three guys piano

well you've got really intense moments

sorry is song where the melody he's

he's just so gentle with the melody on

the lead melody on the song and I did
not see that coming most of this LP is
nothing but recreations of popular hip

why these dudes play with so much
sincerity they're taking songs relevant
to them and reinventing them so what's
relevant to these guys Gang Starr not
old dirty bastard Joy Division slum
village Flying Lotus and the soundtrack

I'm not trying to say this album is

others there takes on slum villages fall

the world is yours I think are the best

the only reinterpretation that I didn't

camel and the reason I didn't care for

funny there's kind of an experimentally

a nice
from the other songs I would totally be

maybe combine it with their jazzier

some of you may be much younger than me
or much older than me and because of
that you don't quite understand that in
the late 90s Nintendo 64 was the [ __ ]
the Ocarina of Time was like the life of
a lot of kids back then mine too
to the point where the music of that

among them is one of the best and the
reason why to me is because it works
outside of the nostalgia you don't have

because the musicianship is so strong
the solos are great the melodies are
clear and emotive these guys are having
fun playing together so for the listener
it's a fun experience to hear I think
this LP is a little all over the place
but bad bad not good to me is still in a
very kind of fetal stage all of their
material isn't really coming together
and flowing in this one focused
direction still despite the fact that
this LP is a combination of older and
newer material and features a lot of
different ideas it flows pretty well so
I'm excited about what I'm hearing on
this LP I'm excited about what it means
for this band what it means for jazz
music and what it means for hip-hop and
what it means for music fans - I'm
feeling a strong 7 - a light 8 on this
